intro: Symphysicarpus, commonly known as the sandcherry, is a genus of flowering plants in the Rosaceae family. These shrubs are characterized by their woody stems and showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The fruits are small, red or yellow berries that mature in the fall and are edible for both humans and wildlife. Symphysicarpus species are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They play an important role in supporting local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various animals.
